description: This place is the best! The wonderful neighborhood vibe, friendly workers, sandwiches made with super high-quality ingredients at very competitive prices (for this neighborhood) keep me coming back again and again.
author: Ariel M.

description:
I stood at the counter waiting for someone to ring me up for a good 10 minutes yesterday. I was not ordering a sandwich or slicing, so apparently they have no process for ringing you up if you just buy something from the case. No one at the register, no numbers. They just ignore you while they argue with the customers ordering sandwiches.

 I've had bad customer service experiences here before (being told to wait to pay while the only guy there called in tomorrow's bread order, again after waiting a long time. Looking for burrata and being handed one that was expired with a shrug and an explanation that the dates don't really mean anything). It my fault for coming back. It is a cute shop and I want to love it but the guys who work there are obnoxious.

Luckily Luke's down the street had the same burrata for $2 cheaper.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Very cool deli / cheese spot on Cole.

I recently had a delicious goat cheese sandwich at another sandwich spot so when pressed to order something here I asked if they had anything with goat cheese .

They indicated the "vegetarian " did ... so I went with that and added turkey and avocado on Dutch crunch . Super duper good and it came out to $12.50 which isn't cheap but hey it's SF...

Friendly guys behind the counter as well .
author: Rod M.

description:
What a great little hidden shop.  I love cheese so they had me at the name and then knowing they made sandwiches and had a variety of other goodies, I needed to check them out.  I ordered the Jamon Serrano and my wife had the Calabrese Salami.  Both were really good and the calabrese had a nice kick to it.

The people working were helpful in guiding me in the right direction on what type of sandwich to get.
author: Blake B.

description:
Service is gracious. This is the kind of place where you can sample your cheese before you buy it. 

Their sandwiches are wonderful. My favorite for a long while was their butter, ham, and cheese, just like my adopted German family used to make.
author: Camille L.

description:
Say Cheese is a gem in Cole Valley! I stumbled upon this adorable cheese shop that also has wines, charcuterie, breads and crackers, olive oil, jams, nuts, and deli sandwich selections.

Upon walking into the shop, it was intimidating making a selection wine and cheese selection. But the staff that was at the shop made it much easier by giving me various cheese samples, and made recommendations based off my wine style preference and budget.

Although the pricing is on the higher end (ie: $9 for a box of crackers!) I believe you are paying for the quality of wines and cheeses and the excellent service.

Highly recommend Say Cheese if you are looking for a good place that serves anything cheese and wine related and accompanying deli sandwiches. 

Thank you Say Cheese staff for your terrific service and recommendations
author: Christie S.

description: I love ham and Gouda sandwiches. Gouda wasn't on their list of sandwich cheeses but I inquired and they excitedly obliged to make me one. All I can say is, it's better than any ham and Gouda I've ever had, even in Gouda.
author: David R.

description: Review solely on the customer service. I walked in and looked at the salami selection they had to offer and asked the guy behind the counter if they cured their own salamis in store and the older gentleman with longer gray hair made a smart remark back "yeah, and I have the water buffalo out back." His coworker looked at me after his comment in discomfort because it was a rude response. I walked out feeling stupid for asking such a simple question. That is no way to educate customers coming in and out of the store who are curious of the products.
author: Christina M.

description: A great neighborhood treasure. Great cheese and best sandwiches on the street!
author: Sari S.

description:
I love cheese. I eat and fruit cheese for breakfast sometimes. Interestingly enough, those are my best days. The days I start with cheese and fruit.

This little shop packs and stacks a lot of inventory. You have a great variety of cheeses to choose from but they also sell accompaniments like fruit jam, gels, nuts, breads, crackers, olives, jarred veggies, and wine. 

Oh let's not be hasty when mentioning the wine. Give the shelves a careful browse. You're sure to find an old world favorite to pair with your cheese haul. 

Haul. Yes. That's what I said. I can't walk out with a little wedge like a normal person. I have to have at least 3 cheeses to feel excited about life ...put the spring in my step. 

Smile. 

St Augr. They have it here. Score a wedge, pair it with fruit jam, lovely crackers and a bottle of wine. 

Life is meant for delicious moments like this. 

Parking can be tricky but you'll feel mighty accomplished when you find one. There are lots of shops to visit in this neighborhood so prepare to be here for a while. 

Store is cute, service is great, selection of cheeses makes me pretty happy. 

Oh - and if that isn't enough, they also have  caviar and sandwiches! 

Go. Shop. Enjoy.
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
Woooooow-whee! This place is an absolute gem.

Say Cheese is the first spot in San Francisco that made me feel like I was in Europe. (I come from two European imports and go back to visit frequently :)). The store is small but bursting at the seams with incredible cheeses, meats, wine and candies.

After our first visit, we left dreaming about the sandwiches. I quickly scanned the menu while we were inside and couldn't wait to return and order one (we unfortunately came right after getting lunch elsewhere).

The wait was worth it.

I got the Black Forest Ham on wheat with Mendocino mustard, cambazola cheese, arugula, tomatoes, onion and pickle - WOW. Wow, wow, wow. (There is no better word for the food here, sorry.) It was absolutely divine.

My friend got the Rosemary Smoked Ham on wheat and was just as thrilled. The sound effects from both of us while we were eating were hysterical. There were many "mmmmmm"s along with "Oh my gosh..." and "DAMN!"

Both sandwiches survived an hour-long drive to Mt. Tam plus two hours of hiking - bouncing around a backpack - before we stopped to devour them. I can't imagine a better moment; eating a Say Cheese sandwich during golden hour on Mount Tam is a dream come true. The only thing you have to do is bite in and savour all the goodness that is life.
author: Nic Z.

description:
Heard good things about this place and stood around for over 10 minutes while they made people sand witches etc... to only find out they don't have bread.
It would of been nice to let me know sooner?
Thanks for nothing.
Working on a Saturday and hungry at
Diner time
author: Patrick M.

description: They make excellent suggestions for pairings and the cannolis!!!!! Oh I can't say enough about these cannolis!!!! Handcrafted and delectable!!!
author: Amber F.

description: I've been coming to Say Cheese for 10+ years - ever since I was a little kid. The faces of my favorite sandwich shop have changed over time but the quality remains the same! My favorite sandwiches include the Prosciutto Caprese and the Cajun Turkey. All of their olive oils and the different aioli they put on their sandwiches are top notch. They sometimes have sandwich specials like the "Cole Valley Club" that my boyfriend got - and that I asked for bites of until it was nearly half gone. The guys at Say Cheese are knowledgeable about everything they sell in the shop (cheeses, wines, oils, meats, etc). With such quality food and products, I can safely say that I'll be coming around for the next 10+ years too!
author: Claire H.

description: Worst encounter I have ever had with the manager. I asked a simple question and he was completely rude to the point he had other staff members apologizing for his vulgar response. Take your business elsewhere and stay clear.
author: Ryan S.

description: I LOVE SAY CHEESE! Their sandwiches are so good! Plus their selection of wine and cheese is perfect. I love having this spot so close to my house to quickly grab snacks and lunch sometimes. Last time I was here I got the goat cheese sandwich on sourdough. Their ciabatta bread is also wonderful.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Me: "hi, do you guys have Malbec"
Say Cheese; "I don't really like the wine here but I think we do, I'm not a wine specialist"
Me: "is there someone there that is"
Say Cheese: "not right now"
6.30 on a Thursday night.
Despite what might be a good selection, this level of service is laughable.
author: Sharon L.

description:
While it's not one I frequent regularly, Say Cheese is a great specialty shop that, among its many products, offers cheese (big surprise, I know!), pastured eggs, pâtè, charcuterie, wine, olives, sweets, and sandwiches. Most commonly I've come in for the pâtè, which is a delicious treat, and have occasionally gotten sandwiches as well.

Hadn't been in a while and decided to pick up a sandwich! Though a touch pricier than many nearby places, Say Cheese can boast higher quality of ingredients than many of these other places, which in my mind justifies the occasional sandwich from them.

My Jamon Serrano sandwich ($12.50) came with prosciutto, arugula, manchego, and romesco sauce. It had an ample amount of prosciutto but was also kind of dry tasting. I'd add avocado, olive oil, aioli or something for better texture. I ate half right away and I think the other half I had later on actually tasted better. One of those "leftovers win" scenarios. 

My boyfriend had the roast beef w/ cheddar ($11? I think?) which I had a bite of and had way more substance than mine. I may get this one next time with a cheese other than cheddar, which can upset my stomach.

The menu will make you drool.
author: Megan D.

description: Awesome food. Love this selection. Cheese of course, but great sausage, salami, and other cured meats, plus great wine and bread.
author: Zaria M.

description: Great cheese shop, but not limited to cheese.  My favorites include their dolmas, sandwiches, dried meat selections.
author: Brycen M.

description: I have been going to Say Cheese for years. The team there is very knowledgeable about charcuterie, cheese, wine, and specialty items. Their platters are outstanding, and they make great sandwiches too.  I have never been disappointed here.
author: Chris B.

description:
Great selection of cheese - but the service can be AWFUL. I've been shopping here for almost 20 years - and often give Say Cheese gift certificates to friends in the food community (with a warning about the service).
It wasn't always this way and, at times, it is still possible to get a helpful cheesemonger but there is a lot of changeover (hmmmmm) and the manager isn't setting a very good example.
author: Anna C.

description:
It doesn't get any better than this. I'm so lucky we picked cole valley to live in when moving to SF, because Say Cheese is a godsend! And I don't like anything else in CV. Just CHEEEEESE. 

Every staff member is knowledgable and helpful, but don't go in looking for a bunch of free samples. Their selection is incredible, I love challerhocker. Try it. 

We've come in multiple times looking for fondue cheeses and every combination we've tried has been drop dead delicious. So much so, that we don't go out for fondue anymore. 

Their selection of meats is also so yummy. I love this place. Love love love.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
This is my guilty pleasure in SF. 

Yeah, yeah, it's gourmet snacks that normally fly in the face of the health-minded folk of the city. Nothing in here aside from the wine and olives is Vegan, so if you're about that you won't like this place. If you don't really care, and want to eat some amazing cheese, charcuterie, sandwiches, olives, and other favorites this place is incredible. 

The selection here is impressive, but the absolute best part about this place is the service. It's daunting to walk into a place where things you may have never seen before are stacked on the shelves. There are dozens and dozens of types of cheese, from smooth to funky, and from every kind of farm animal that has nipples. Not sure what to try? Ask for a recommendation. The people behind the counter are super friendly, helpful, and will tell you honestly if you can get a better bang for your buck with a different product. 

I walked in one time and said that I was looking for some raw cow and goat cheese, something interesting, but not too funky. Then I wanted something that was crazy weird and interesting. I found exactly what I wanted, along with some complementary salamis. I was about to pick up a small round of triple cream cheese and the person behind the counter said he had something way better (and cheaper). He was right. He then did it again when I wanted to buy the standard table water crackers. Again, right on the nose and that's all I buy nowadays. 

Over the last three years I've been here dozens of times, often for a special occasion (wine, cheese, and book dates at Golden Gate Park). One evening I stopped in, they were trying to get rid of some inventory. They tossed a bottle of red wine in with my purchase for the hell of it. It was delicious.
author: Byron E.

description: Great little shop with fine cheeses and cold cuts. Sandwiches are first rate. One star off as the owner no longer hangs out, and the staff is not as knowledgeable as in the past.
author: Tucky D.

description: If you like finding interesting and delicious products, cheese, and wine, Say Cheese is worth the stop.  Even if you don't live in Cole Valley, I would recommend the souljourn for anyone who loves to explore food.  Jason and the gang are very friendly and well educated on the products. They have recently started carrying some interesting pickled and marinated vegetables packed in olive oil in the deli case.  They are awesome and I've not seen these anywhere before.
author: Kathryne B.

description: The staff is awesome. If I lived by here I would probably be filling a subscription to Lipitor. This is nirate and cholesterol heaven. Great quality products coupled with  creative sandwich combinations. Top rate all around. I'll be back.
author: Yoni Z.

description: If u like fancy sandwiches u will like this place. Very good sandos. Wine selection isn't as good as the place down the block, but the sandwiches are nice
author: Dan K.

description:
Best cheese shop in San Francisco so many varieties of cheeses and meats 
I ordered two sandwiches from say cheese boy there were amazing
author: Mike G.

description: I saw this place listed on a blog (SF Eater, Epic SF Sandwiches to Eat Before You Die) as having one of the best sandwiches in SF - Jamon Serrano with manchego, romesco sauce, and arugula on Dutch crunch!  Well, I had to check it out since I was in the area to volunteer.  It was a nice day so I took my sandwich outside on the bench in front of the store to enjoy, and enjoy I did!!  Super fresh ingredients meld together to make this sandwich delectable to all your taste buds.  Mmmm mmm, yes, it is definitely a reason to go to Cole Valley to try this sandwich, and buy some wine and cheese to take home.
author: Maile N.

description:
I absolutely love this place and would give their food 5 stars but I want their owner to know of something happened recently..
I ordered a sandwich and the guy was working on the counter and made my sandwich without washing hands or wearing gloves.

When I asked him why he did that he said, gloves attract more bacteria therefore he did not.


Absolutely unacceptable to give such lame excuse instead of apologizing. This was an African American gentleman working today at 5 pm if the owners care to take action.


I have recommended this place to many friends until now but very turned off today
author: A S.

description:
Fantastic, fantastic place! After spending a half hour tasting and learning and sampling and a little dancing I walked away with an aged manchego, a nice gouda, gorgonzola and a cheese I'd never tried before that smelled like the streets of Taiwan but tasted so, so good. Also there was a decent charcuterie selection, I loved the truffle mousse. 

This will be the go to place for schmancyfancypants dinner parties. Also don't microwave the stinky cheese to melt it. Your house will never be the same.
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
******************************* 937 *******************************

         Loving this cheese shop. While waiting for Zazie, we came in here, nice surprise, snack, cheese, some wines, and more cheese.

        The gentleman that helped us, let us try the stinky blue cheese. He asked what we liked and gave us exactly just that, that beautiful stinky creamy blue cheese from France, arrrrr! We indulged with the crackers, we couldn't wait for Zazie!

        Tiny little shop, I'm not fat but I got a hard to navigate because the shop was packed on Sat. I was so afraid I'm gonna knock everything off the shelves. I'm clumsy and this shop makes me nervous. Other than that, good price point. If I'm in the area again, I would definitely come here to buy more cheese. SAY CHEESE!
author: Manda Bear B.

description: What happened to this place??? This used to be a prized Cole Valley establishment, but I'm afraid that in the last 6 -or-so months, it's gone downhill FAST and fits in with the other mediocre, over-priced eateries on Cole St. I hate that I have to write this review because I (used to) LOVE Say Cheese :( Yesterday, I ordered one of my favorite specialty sandwiches and not only did it take forever to be made, but when I opened it to eat, it was so sloppily slapped together and the once-perfect ratio of ingredients was just... OFF. Definitely not worth the $9 that was once justifiable. The new staff members are also not as friendly and welcoming as the old crew was. Thankfully, the new place on the next block has a delicious deli and super warm staff. That'll be my new go-to sandwich spot in CV :)
author: Linda P.

description:
This place is awesome! The whole staff is welcoming and super excited about cheese! Everything is so fresh and delicious. Don't even get me started with the cheese selection, can anyone say Comte!

So to answer Ian c.'s review he needs to grab a bottle of wine and chill out. These are the best sandwiches in the Bay Area, calm down about your chicken. Also I bet he paid with cash, so what is more dirty cash or the sandwich makers arm? 

Hats off to say cheese, Ian c. You got some issues.
author: Eric F.

description:
Abso-effin-lutely one of the highlights of Cole Valley. Consistently, the staff are uber knowledgable, friendly and damn passionate about cheese (& wine!). It's fun to present them with a scenario, then they seem to know exactly what to select. Example: We're headed to a dinner party of 8 people tonight. We're having seafood appetizers but also pork as the entree. BOOM! 5 different cheeses are selected, we taste all, decide on 3, go with their red and bubbly recommendation, walk into the dinner party like WHADDUP I got a big block...of Camembert for you, dear friends. 

Le sigh.
author: Adele A.

description:
Say Cheese is one of my favorite spots in Cole Valley. The staff is incredibly nice and are always up to give you suggestions on cheese, wines, and sandwiches. I strongly recommend grabbing some sandwiches from Say Cheese and walking to Golden Gate Park for an awesome picnic. 

They do beautiful gift baskets and parties too!
author: Brooks M.

description:
They have a great selection of cheese and wine and assorted dips and tapenades that will  fancify you for any dinner party. 

They also make great sandwiches---WHEN they have bread!  The proprietors pride themselves on being cheese heads, which is all one can ask for from a specialty shop like this.  The problem is they view the sandwich business as far less important and even a nuisance.  

I can't forecast their cheese v. sandwich revenues but one could easily say +60% of their foot traffic is sandwich focused and therefore also a core driver for derivative cheese sales.  

But don't tell them that!  To actually stock bread and other sandwich items would make them a sandwich shop, which they are too important to care about. 

Try ordering a sandwich from them 5 times; you'll be left empty handed on at least 2 of those occasions.  I've been left at the alter by their sandwich mismanagement too many times that I now I even buy my fancy cheese and well-to-do snacks elsewhere, too.

3 stars because its great stuff.  3 stars because they often disappoint.
author: Ian M.

description: Roger and the crew are amazing. The cheese selection is amazing, and the salami is delicious.  Even though I'm not a sandwich lover, their sandwiches are amazing.
author: Loretta S.

description: Say Cheese is golden. Their cheese selection is unparalleled and their wines are killer, and highly curated. I've never had a bad experience with this place. If you find yourself in Cole Valley, go here. Be warned though, it's easy to totally blow it out on wine and cheeses -- they let you sample cheeses and literally none of them are bad.
author: Tini T.

description: Top quality sandwiches, and a ton of good wine and cheeses to choose from. We ordered the caprese and jamon serrano sandwiches and picked up a couple bottles of red. Both excellent. This will be my go-to sandwich shop even though I'm not in the neighborhood!
author: Alexander M.

description:
In the heart of Cole Valley, Say Cheese is seriously killing it. I would normally feel like a complete idiot walking into a store like this because everything looks so fancy, but the staff immediately acknowledges your presence and asks what you're looking for today. Sometimes you know exactly what you want, other times you have no idea. Either way, everyone is so helpful and really knows their cheese...and best meats and wines to pair with this fabulous dairy product. In addition to cheese, this place makes some bomb ass sandwiches and you won't pay an arm and a leg for one (around $8). 

Whether you are looking to impress a new hottie with a gourmet spread or need to feed your sharp cheddar craving, Say Cheese is definitely one of the best places in SF to hit up. I promise, you will LOVE! #colevalleyforlife
author: Ricky M.

description:
My favorite part about Say Cheese is that I can walk in, tell them what I'm looking for, and then feel like a celebrity. All for just buying freaking delicious cheese. I've never met a staff member whose been rude, or not knowledgeable about the various cheeses on display. My personal favorite is the ricotta di limone. It's ricotta cheese that tastes like pound cake. Heaven. 

Next time you go in, ask if they have the cheese that tastes like lemon pound cake. YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!

We've gone in before and told them the occasion, what we want to buy for, and for how many people. They don't up-sell at all and honestly just care about your experience. Best cheese shop in the city. 

Also, please don't forget to call me when this lemon pound cake cheese comes in.
author: Tommy C.

description:
Doing it right. 

Best sandwiches in cole valley, friendliest, most informed staff. I'm not really a cheese person, but I really dig almost everything in this place. 

Amazing wine selection, as well.
author: C O.

description:
Say cheese isn't just a cheese shop. they sell  many types of gourmet foods, cured meats and sammies too. store is small. 

eats: rosemary roasted garlic turkey sammie. (7)
-didn't taste rosemary, roasted garlic, nor turkey
-came with lots of thinly sliced lettuce, mustard, pickles, tomatos, with a generous amount amount of turkey white meat on pantofalin roll. many choices of bread.
-turkey not bland, dry, nor overly flavorful either.
-turkey sammie not a turkey(lemon). very filling.

crumbs:
-store is cramped. bottleneck at cashier/sammie station.
-relatively fast, courteous service for a small crew.
-would reeat if nearby.
author: Victor G.

description:
I love cheese!

This is a great place to sample some amazing cheeses.  I love rummaging through their odds and ends basket for little chunks of cheeses.  This way, I can sample a variety of different ones for a few bucks to find a type I particularly like.

The guys behind the counter are super nice and knowledgable.  They can recommend awesome cheeses for you to try if you have an idea of what you do and don't prefer.  Great selection of cured meats as well, I love their prosciutto. They carry Cow Girl Creamery among many others.

Of course, this is a gourmet shop, so expect gourmet prices.
author: Alice L.

description:
Great staff.  They seem very knowledgeable and even better, they are passionate about what they sell
Great deli with fantastic food. Lots of cheeses for sample and purchase. Homemade sandwiches are really good. Had fresh prosciutto and mozzarella with a bit of fresh olive oil.  OH MY GOODNESS!!

This is now on our must go to places on our trips to the city!!
author: David M.

description:
This is my new go-to place for charcuterie and cheese. Staff is very helpful and friendly and the selection is great. Especially their cheese selection. And unlike other stores with pre-sectioned cheese blocks that are way too expensive, these guys will section the cheese to whatever portion you'd like. 
If you guys could order some Jamon Iberico, I'll be hooked! I've now tried multiple meat shops in SF and failed to find it.
author: Dhruv L.

description:
Steve was the star and very knowledgeable about the cheeses we tried. 
We ended up getting some buffalo cheese, salami, herbed bread. Delicious! Had some wine with it and it was just perfect.
Fancy cheese place. Will go back and try their sandwiches - heard they are yummy!
author: PreciousSwt P.

description:
jesus! I LOVE cheese but upon walking into this cute little store I found out that I dont know the first thing about CHEESE! 

My boyfirend and I were on the hunt for italian bread and cheese in the streets of San Fransisco.
And by luck we stumbled upon this cute little joint. 
We were seriously in awe by all the cheese selections they had to offer. I really didnt have the slightest clue at what exactly I was starring at. 
Thankfully the staff here is beyong helpful. The guy helping us out was like a cheese guru! He was up to par with all the latest news in the cheese world. 
He gave us a sample of the CAORA BLANCA...I was speechless! 
Amazing cheese, and just like that we were SOLD!
author: Jackie R.

description:
I love this place, and go often. However there are only 2 sales people I like to be helped by and I dodge the other two. 

One is Hilary and the other is a young chap. Both of these sales people are helpful and provide terrific customer assistance as cheese enthusiasts, love them. Then there are the other two staff. The new young lady needs to stop touching her face/nose while she is working at a cheese counter and be more professional and a little less condescending to customers while the tall man needs to inform you of how expensive a cheese is, if it is hella expensive and be more careful about cc transactions.

Re: cheese, its awesome! They have a wide array and provide samples and I always feel like there is something new and exciting to try. 

Re meats: really good, we like the spicy ones. 

In fact, all of the food/wine I have tried from here is good.
author: Jenn D.

description: Slowest service ever. Food is good, though pricey and nice selection but if there's more than one customer in the store, be prepared to wait a looonnnnggg time.
author: Mark R.

description:
Don't let the small size of this well established cheese + other goodies shop fool you. They carry a large selection of cheeses, wines, chocolates, and other mouth watering foods. They also make  sandwiches to die for. 
If you're in the neighborhood do give Say Cheese a try.
author: H. S.

description:
Tucked into a neighborhood, this place has smiling customer service. Good selection of cheese, and my friends said the wine selection was also great. The sandwich menu looked awesome; however, we weren't ready to eat yet. 

A good selection of jams, mustards, and pickle type things as well.

I'd visit here if I lived in closer...
author: Amy O.

description:
I've heard good things from other, but they have to succeed for me. They are out of something so for my last three visits, have not been able to offer me the sandwich that I want. Its not little things either, last two times they are out of chicken!? So, no chicken sandwiches at all?

Also, the last time they were able to make me a sandwich that I wanted, the guy making it didn't wash his hands (he had previously been staking shelves) and didn't wear gloved either. He handled everything with his unwashed dirty hands. So.......
author: Ian C.

description:
I woke up this morning to nothing in the house, but one sad frozen waffle (no syrup).  That waffle was enough to keep me alive until roughly 1:30 pm when I finally convinced my husband (who had just woken up) that we needed to leave the house for supplies.  Rough night last night...  But luckily, we decided on getting sandwiches at Say Cheese.  We left Say Cheese with the following, all of which I highly recommend:

- Havarti sandwich
- salami sandwich
- gummy bears
- Kettle Chips
- chocolate chip cookies
- two pepperoni sticks
- a fig cookie
- Mexican soda
- blood orange soda
- four cheese tortellini

So yeah, I haven't had to leave the house since.  Thank goodness, because Ice and Coco marathons don't just watch themselves.
author: Amy N.

description: Amazing service! The man helped us pick out an amazing red wine, cheese and salami. It was all so perfect! Plus who doesn't love to sample cheese!
author: Macy M.

description:
So the first thing one notices here is the smell.  I'm not sure why I didn't expect a cheese shop to have a rather pungent aroma, but it does.  This may bother some people, but after my initial shock, I kinda got used to it.

But if your nose was too sensitive for that small barrier, then it's certainly your loss, since you miss out on both the daunting selection and superb service.  I admit that I am not cheese aficionado at all, so I was really intimidated when I saw the varieties that they had available.  Maybe Say Cheese recognized that other people were similarly paralyzed from the realization of their own ignorance in the face of decision and choice, which may have led to their policy of letting people try out whatever cheeses they damn well please.  This includes people who were just waiting in line, since the cheese had already been sliced, so why waste it?  

What I really noticed was not only how knowledgeable the staff was, but how passionate they were.  Their enthusiasm for cheeses was really infectious, which is fantastic for business since I'm fairly certain I bought about 150% more cheese than I actually intended when I went in.  And it makes me want to come back for more, since really, those cheese I bought were absolutely delightful.  

And I'm only going to briefly mention their salami and wine selection, which are likewise great.  If only I had the opportunity to indulge in all three, but alas, it was late enough in the day that I couldn't justify a sandwich.  But there will be other days and other opportunities, and I hope that Say Cheese remains where it is for a long time.

Now if you'll excuse me, I think I feel a heart attack coming.  Oof.
author: Norman S.

description:
Say Cheeeeese....

I didn't get the name of the person who helped me choose some delicious cheeses but they were very knowledgeable and helped me picked some great cheeses i never tried before.

I recommend this place to find some unique cheeses to try.
author: Alice W.

description: Holy shit what an awesome cheese shop. Stumbled upon by accident on the way to Amoeba. The person working there was great about sampling and walked away with a small sliver of Pont L'Eveque from Normandy with olive crackers to snack on during the walk. Prices were awesome and customer service was excellent.
author: Shila B.

description:
Delicious. Stopped in for a sandwich and I only wish I was hungrier and thirstier. I had a turkey sandwich with fresh mozzarella and wasn't disappointed. The bread was great and the balsamic vinegar was a nice alternative to normal condiments. 

The people working there were great, lots of personality and I'm glad I stopped by.

It will be a nice place to return to when I'm in the area again!
author: Eliza D.

description:
Wow, this place is GREAT!!! I came unknowingly 2 min before closing and the guys were still great offering a number of cheeses for me to try before choosing. They were all very knowledgeable and helpful. I picked up 3 cheeses, some semifreddi's bread and some yummy cerminelli salumi. 
They have a GREAT selection of cheeses, good charcuterie selection and most of all extraordinary employees! It's worth a special trip from anywhere in the bay area and especially if you're already in the city
author: Alex L.

description: This is absolutely one of my favorite cheese shops in the City.  Their selection is great, and the people who work there extremely knowledgeable.  Whenever I have a special occassion where I need a selection of good cheeses, I try to make sure I come by this shop and take time to taste and discuss possible combinations.  The staff is friendly, and they often will tell you about whether they think they will have something coming in the future, or have had something in the past, that they think would work for you.  Definitely love this place.
author: Scott E.

description:
This is an authentic cheese and gourmet food boutique. They have a good selection and the staff is very knowledgeable and courteous. 

This review is mostly for those looking to prepare a raclette meal. After trying various locations across the city, Say Cheese has become my go to place for raclette cheese.  They have both French and Swiss. It will be expensive obviously if you have to buy 4lbs for a large party (like I usually do) but the price is right, look no further you won't find cheaper. They also have the raclette machine. I rented it a few times from them, now I got my own on Amazon.

Their cured meat selection is good, but if you need large quantities for a raclette Say Cheese is too expensive, you can find other places with a larger selection at a much lower price.
author: Annabelle G.

description: A cheese board in the making for Thanksgiving with goodies from Say Cheese in Cole Valley.  Loic Nicolas had introduced me to this place with his posting about their  fabulous French butter.  With the knowledgeable professional assistance from Steve, I purchased St. Agour, Brillat Savarin,Ossau Iraty, Pork Mousse Truffle, imported olives and walnuts.  One of the city's hidden gems, with a nice selection of wines, meats, condiments, and chocolates.  Tiny shop, mighty offerings!
author: Kea C.

description:
Great selection of cheese, cured meat and wine. Friendly customer service. I tried a small sample of new cheeses before I bought. Coppa (pork shoulder) is amazing and not overly salted like many other places.

I'm glad I can walk here from where I live. Love it.
author: Saran R.

description: This is a great cheese and sandwich shop.  Their prosciutto and mozzarella sandwich is toe curling, eyes to back of head good.  If you're a wine and cheese person, it's a great to go with a lot of variety.  The staff is very knowledgable about their cheese as well.  So why only the four review?  I watch the staff make sandwiches and I cringe everytime they take money, give change and go right back to taking orders and making sandwiches.  Shouldn't you squeeze a hand washing in there?!?  I'm mean seriously!  Touch money, give change then go right back to making sandwiches,  It actually made me stop going there for awhile.  Don't get me wrong, I'm not a germ freak but its and easily correctable problem.  Get with it guys.
author: Christian W.

description:
I can't believe I'm reviewing a cheese shop. I just wondered in here for the heck of it and they were so nice I had to stay and order a roast beef sandwich with OMG pepperjack cheese that was so fresh and alive in my mouth. 
I think I'm in love!
author: Some D.

description: Really great sandwiches that you can enjoy in the park.  Also they have a huge selection of cheeses and cured meats.
author: Bennett H.

description:
So there was a time, when my grandpa was a boy, when you could go to a deli and the butchers sharpened their knives and hung large cuts of cured meats from hooks around the ceiling of the joint, and the dairymen delivered fresh product in wax-paper wrappers, and you could have a sandwich made that would taste as good as a dip in the watering hole down at the quarry ...

You will not experience this at Say Cheese. But what you do get: The Best motherfucking sandwiches in the city of San Francisco. The best wine advice - and selection - of any store of its size, probably in the Bay Area. And oh, the cheeses ... the goats and sheeps and cows and goatsheepcowsmilk concoctions, soft ones, hard ones, skinny ones, fat ones, sweet ones and salty ones, rindy and creamy and moldy ones.

This is truly a cheese-lover's shop - with the added bonus of catering not just to ungulate devotees. You'll find a sizable and impressive collection of lactose-free goat and sheeps' milk cheeses here, and a staff who know everything about everything about the dairyman's alchemy. They stock some of the best wines available in northern California, with vintages ranging from the south coast and SLO, up through Sonoma and Mendo and over to the inland valleys.

But what you REALLY want is a sandwich. Grab a side of gourmet olives out of the deli case, and a fancy adult soda-beverage, and sit on the bench in the sun to experience pure Cole Valley bliss.

(*Insider's hint: Say Cheese is owned by the same folks who own Reverie Cafe, and they're totally cool if you take your sandwich out to the garden in back)
author: Mateo L.

description: What a great find!  Cured meats, a wide variety of cheeses, friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Old school charms.
author: Kristen S.

description: LOVE the charcuterie, cheeses and all the other culinary delights at this wonderful establishment.  For lunch I had simply a small wedge of smoked gouda and a tiny fig-and-date pastry...they were so dense and rich, it was enough.....I will definitely be back when in the SF area.
author: Lisa S.

description: The real deal.  Tons of variety, and impressive layout.  In addition to cheese, they have a huge variety of all the complementary items -- authentic prosciutto (a personal fav) to be specific.  Yum!
author: Mel G.

description: Come here and you'll end up spending more than you planned. So much great stuff! We're visiting from LA. Jealous that Say Cheese isn't in our neighborhood. Friends live in the area. We make sure to stop in EVERY time we're in town.
author: Jimmy K.

description:
If I could give negative stars to this business, I would.  In a big city where there are so many choices for good cheese shops, and businesses in general, you would think that shop owners would at least try to be polite to their potential customers.

This guy does not.

The other morning, my husband and I got our coffee at Tully's down the street in Cole Valley, and then strolled back to our car.  We popped into Say Cheese just to check it out, because we're always happy to learn about new cheese shops.  We went up to the counter of this cramped, non-wheelchair accessible shop, looked at the various selections (which were on the slightly pricey side, based on my experience with other locally owned cheese shops in SF), and were about to ask the man behind the counter for some assistance when he started berating us for our Tully's coffee:

"Instead of buying your coffee from Tully's, which is a big chain, you should go nextdoor instead.  Tully's always burns their coffee anyway, and nextdoor they serve the same kind of coffee Thomas Keller serves at French Laundry.  It's much better."  (Note:  I'm paraphrasing, since I didn't tape record the conversation...but this is pretty much what he said)

Baffled and taken aback by this man's brusqueness, I stammered out that we enjoy our Tully's coffee, which doesn't taste burnt to us, and I enjoy the mochas I get there.  Why I felt the need to rationalize my purchase to this acrid man is beyond me.  I was just so shocked that he would be so rude.  

He proceeded to tell me that he's the owner of that coffee shop, Reverie, as well as this cheese shop.  He then launched into a tirade about how I should try the "bacon bar".  When I asked what that was, he repeated himself loudly and rudely, sounding out eat syllable slowly, as though I was stupid: "BAY-CON BAR!!!"

What a rude, rude man.  I don't care how good he thinks his bacon bars are (which he said is a chocolate bar with bacon in it, ICK, and "the next big thing in the food world"...as if!), I wouldn't buy one from him if he was the last person selling chocolate on earth!!!  At that point, my husband and I, who'd been about to buy cheese BEFORE this venomous man opened his sanctimonious mouth, locked eyes with one another, and just walked out.  We'd had enough.  

I've noticed a lot of rudeness and snootiness from shop owners in Cole Valley overall (noteable exceptions being Tully's, which is why I will always get my coffee there when in the neighborhood), but this really takes the cake!!  

In the future, I'll go back to my beloved Cheese Boutique on the corner of Irving and 12th, where the woman who works there is always polite and kind to me, patient and respectful of my choices, and VERY reasonably priced.  I'll also buy my cheese from Country Cheese Co. on Divisadero, Cowgirl Creamery in the Ferry Building, and basically any other place where I can get good cheese from a nice, decent human being who doesn't verbally assault me!!

I sincerely hope that this man reads my review and realizes that maybe he should be a little more polite to patrons in the future.  But I doubt he'll do either.  So, instead, I can only hope that you, dear reader, will be able to make your own informed decision about checking this place out before subjecting yourself to the potential rudeness you might encounter inside this store.
author: Amy L.

description:
Wow, maybe I just come in here at the wrong time but they have sandwiches?! I usually beeline for the pate, handy little bags of nuts or some sort of Brie or gorgonzola...  But sandwiches?! I need to look up instead of just down at the display case lol...

Anyhoo, super knowledgeable staff. If you want to learn more about cheese (a must on everybodys bucket list I believe) but are intimidated by Whole Foods vast cheese selection, the pretentiousness of the cheese school or the fast pace of Cowgirl you should come here. They'll walk you through the cheese selection process (and oh yes, it is a process) and you'll leave with not only a tasty cheese but with new found cheese confidence. 

Ok I guess everybody will have a different experience but you should go anyways.  Chances are SC's selection is going to be better anyways :)
author: Jammir G.

description:
Cute little neighborhood cheese, sandwich, charcuterie meats shop. 

I got some spanish olives, jamon serrano ($20.99/lb), and I saw jamon iberico (10.99/ounce).
author: Jboogie L.

description:
I've always had an exemplary experience here:

-I've been a few dollars short of the card minimum and out of cash and they let it slide. 
-After finishing my purchase of some cheese once the owner helped another customer and then came back to continue our discussion of better ways to store cheese without quickly accumulating mold. 
-Gossiping about an alleged previous and pretentious customer intent on making an overwrought five-cheese macaroni and cheese where the individual flavors would be obliterated. 
-On one occasion after placing my order a staff member suggested I try another, less expensive cheese in the same style that we both agreed was superior to the one I had originally chosen. How many shops actually talk you down in price?

I've never been pressured to buy more than I wanted or a more expensive product, I've always been steered towards excellent cheese and provided with generous samples to find what I want. Whether I have only a vague idea or an overly-exacting specification it's always met with attentive service without being made to feel rushed or patronized.

It's not where I buy my everyday "utility cheese", but if it's going to stand on its own or be the highlight of a dish I always come here and I've never once been let down. Even the sandwiches and, yes, Cafe Reverie next door (same owners) are great.

Probably my only real complaint is that they carried some excellent bacon a year or so ago and don't appear to have it in stock any more and the Cajun Turkey sandwich seems to be using jalapenos rather than pepperoncinis.

I can't say it's the best cheese shop in town, but being the closest one to my house I don't feel the need to head anywhere else.
author: Mark S.

description:
This past week the wife and I took the muni out to the Haight area to do some shopping. Just off Carl and Cole there are some good restaurants that we planned on checking out before we made our way to Haight. The place we planned on eating at wasn't opened yet, and we needed to find an alternative. While walking down the street I peeked in Say Cheese, and after looking at the menu, it looked like a good affordable place to eat. 

Besides buying cheese, wines, deli meats, and other kitchen accessories, you can choose from a variety of sandwich themes, or create your own. We decided to get a vegetarian and a chicken sandwich, then split them between ourselves. The bread is a circular roll, maybe 6" and just the right size for a sandwich. The vegetarian had goat cheese, tomato, sprouts, and olive tapenade. The other had roasted chicken, sun dried tomatoes, fresh basil, pesto mayo, and jack cheese. 

The thing about these sandwiches that makes them so amazing, besides the high quality fresh ingredients, is the amount of each item that was put on the sandwich. The vege had just the right amount of goat cheese and did not compete with the olive tapenade, all while the sprouts and tomato rested between the center of the two. The roasted chicken was amazing, and pesto mayo was creamy and not too overboard. The sun dried tomatoes were the best I have had. They didn't have that odd taste that most sun dried tomatoes I have eaten had, just a subtle flavor that worked well with the pesto, fresh basil, and chicken. 

Overall, the price was great and we left full but not stuffed. The most important part, was that my wife and I had huge smiles from the stellar sandwiches we just ate. Make sure you stop by, I mean c'mon I gave it 5 stars and I rarely if ever do that. It's worth it.
author: Josh G.

description:
Once when I was picking up a load of delicious foods with one of my lazy brothers, after I paid for everything and reached over to pick up my big bag of groceries, the cheese dude picked up my bag before I could get it, and held it out for my brother, wearing an expression that was extremely meaningful and equally easy to read.  With nary a word, the cheese dude taught my brother how to be a cooler guy.  Just like that.

This place is about more than just sweet, sweet cheese:  they serve up creative imported goods (that make great last minute gifts, btw), fresh pastas, scrumptious sammiches, nice wines... and tasty old school life lessons.
author: Rosie W.

description:
Big Love to Say Cheese
Obviously  the cheese is amaaazing. 
but the sammies are so the best! fresh ingredients and yummy breads and spreads. OH yeah, they always have the best chocolate and wine as well. 

Yes the cheese is pricey, but it is so worth it. The sandwiches are totally reasonably priced..i believe between $6-8. you can sit on the little bench outside, or walk down to the park. 

SUPPORT LOCAL BUSINESSES!!!
author: Yuliya R.

description:
Just had an awkward and uncomfortable experience buying cheese from a new member of staff who didn't know very much about cheese. 

I visit this store fairly often and I was told to come this afternoon (delivery is on Wednesday) to sample and purchase a selection of cheeses for my holiday meal. So I scheduled a special visit, at the appointed day and time, and it was a huge let down. 

If I had been served by one of the experienced staff I expect it would have been better, but I wasn't. I feel for the newbie, who was nice but clearly wasn't adequately trained.  I'm not going to say it ruined my Christmas but I now have a headache and I am a little peeved.
author: C J M.

description:
Say Cheese benefits from its proximity to Zazie.  4 out of the 5 times that I have been here were the result of excessive wait times.

Nonetheless, this place has great sandwiches. Today I had the Calabrese Salame, which consisted of roasted red peppers, provolone, balsamic, and salami on a ciabbata roll.  Delicious.

Pretty standard prices for fancy sandos, $7-$10.
author: Phil P.

description:
One of my fellow friend/yelper and I used to frequent this place everytime we visited Revery Cafe next door. The sandwiches were very good, but we had a common problem.

The sandwich makers and workers there were very smug and rude. Talking to them or asking them a question about any of the food. We'd get talked down to for absolutely no reason.

Sadly if it wasn't for these deli workers looking down upon us fellow Franciscans. I would've gave it at least a 4.

But hey if you want a good sandwich and to feel belittled by deli men. COME HERE! (yea right.)
author: Tip S.

description:
Wow... it's been almost 7 months since I last decided to give this place a shot -- even though I walk past this place twice a day, everyday. 

I tried it again today -- and guess what? Yep, they were out of wheat bread. Waaah-waaah. But here's the thing: I TOTALLY lowered my expectations before walking in so I wasn't too let down. I'm discovering that when I reduce my expectations to almost nothing, it's easier to be a "satisfied customer."  I actually raised my star-rating to a 3... only because the the sandwich is fine and the Kettle-brand potato chips are AMAZING (yah, you can buy them anywhere.)

So this time, the guy (glasses, pierced ears) that helped me was super-nice. But the other guy that works in there is a world-class pr*ck. I just read through some of the reviews, and it seems like I'm not the only one who feels this way. Today, while Nice was making my sandwich, Pr*ck whispered something in Nice's ear about me (perhaps in reference to my Yelp posting?) -- you know you can tell when you're being talked about. So after my sandwich was made, I asked Nice "What did he (Pr*ck) say about me?"  To which Nice replied "Huh? What do you mean?"  [Boys, I'm not stupid... But I give Nice credit for his loyalty to Pr*ck.]

Anyway...  in a nutshell:
1. The sandwich was good (but not on the bread I wanted.)
2. Friendly service from Nice.
3. Pr*ck was a pr*ck.
author: Joel G.

description:
While their cheese counter is both expansive and delicious, their sandwiches are to be avoided. I don't know how they manage to make such poor sandwiches with such high quality ingredients, but they really drop the ball. 

I always loved coming in here for cheese, and will probably coming to shop here, but i was truly amazed with how poor their sandwiches were.
author: Allyson S.

description: Delicious. I usually order a sandwich here but from time to time I pick up some new fresh cheese to try out. The staff here are really friendly and are generous when you ask to sample cheese. They have a great selection of cheeses to choose from...you will never leave disappointed.
author: Gunter L.

description:
I looove me some local cheese shop!

Even though the new WF opened on Haight, I will still be coming here for my cheese. This place has far more selection with better quality cheeses. I'm really picky about my brie and it seems to me that the brie at the big market is always overripe to the point of unattractive gooyness. Say Cheese brie is always *just right*.

Also, did I mention the sandwiches here are bombtastic? And the baguettes seem to always be soft and fresh! Nom nom nom...
author: Rachel H.

description: I've been here several times. They have a lot of cheese obviously but they also have a bunch of other cool little accoutrements and wine.  The staff are all extremely knowledgeable about the cheeses and not shy about giving samples.  They also have a good truffle chicken/pork liver mousse (the duck not so much, maybe personal taste, maybe rotten lol).  The dolmas were good, other than that though I haven't tried any other prepared foods/sandwiches but the cured meats look amazing.
author: Monica H.

description:
Let me start by saying I'm not a cheese eater. Yep I said it. However, if I ever wanted cheese for a party/gift, this would be the place to go. The staff is always awesome and friendly; and most importantly, very very knowledgeable.

I go here for the sandwiches. Truth be told, every once in a while I decline to "hold the cheese", as the pepper jack on the cajun turkey sandwich just compliments so well. Add in some avocado and oh its bliss on bread! Their meats are always fresh and delicious. I've also had some kind of roasted chicken which was also very good.

This actually is a destination sandwich shop in my opinion. Its not too out of the way, and if you drive, there is generally some kind of meter parking during the day.

It can get a little crowded inside the tiny shop, and ordering might take a few minutes, but its not too long, and the service and food are well worth the wait.

Side note, they have a wonderful selection of wine, olives, deli meat, olive oil, and other Italian-ness faire.
author: Morgan A.

description: Tried say cheese today on the recommendation of my coworker.  I had the smoked salmon sandwich and it was delicious.   All the ingredients tasted fresh and the prices were reasonable.  The only knock is that the way the store is laid out it can be a little awkward to order sandwiches while other people are trying to order deli meat/sausages.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Was really excited that a biz associate brought in sandwiches from Say Cheese instead of the usual nasty Specialty's (gross). 
Wish i had the mozarrella sandwich...but the chicken pesto was pretty good. Would love to try other sandwiches from the place
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
The sandwiches here are delicious, filling, and very satisfying. Throw in a bag of kettle chips and a bottle of organic lemon aid, and I'd say you have a perfect start to a picnic. (By the way, there is a very cute dog park on the side of Burgermeister. On a sunny day I see people have picnics or just laying out.)

I'd normally rate Say Cheese a solid 5 stars, but the prices can be a bit steep. After all, although the ingredients taste high quality, it is a sandwich after all. And paying around $15 for a sandwich, a drink, and chips does seem high. But it's San Francisco after all! 

I've never gotten anything else besides what I've already mentioned, but the cheese/wine/meat selection does look spot on. 

And I've also read reviews talking about bad service. I've been in here a handful of times since moving to the neighborhood and I've always left happy.
author: Sara K.

description: This place is great. The nice girl behind the counter recommended a noor hollander cheese because I told her I like Gouda. It was very tasty, so I had to buy a wedge. Will definitely come back again the next time I am in town to try other stuff....
author: Dee Y.

description: Next time in SF, I'd like to explore Say Cheese much more extensively (this could be a 5 star after repeat visits).  I got a very tasting little slice of pecorino here, a bottle of wine, and a very soft and lovely ciabatta.   The gentleman that helped was extremely knowledgeable and eager to make sure I got exactly what I wanted. He let me taste a wide range of cheeses before I made my purchase.  Recommended.
author: Delan B.

description: Geek out on cheese! There's goat, raw milk, maytag, pecorino, swiss, emmentaler, havarti and more. The guys that work here are like the comic book guy, but with cheese. Ask them for a recommendation, and they'll give a lecture on their favorites. Just check out their selection of cheeses on the big board and go nuts. The sandwiches here are also very good, especially on the dutch crunch roll. And don't worry that there's nowhere to sit inside the deli, you can take your sandwich into the cafe next door and eat it there. It's owned by the same people. There's even a really nice backyard patio where you can get some sun. The prices of the cheeses and meats are probably a little higher than you would find at your local grocery store, though.
author: Saunders C.

description:
At least!  A $6.00 sandwich in Cole Valley!  Rejoice!

I didn't shop any of the wines, cheeses, or meats that weren't in my sandwich.  It's a cute shop -- super-tiny, with no seating.  Had to walk home to enjoy my roast beef and cream cheese sandwich.
author: Bill H.

description:
I can't believe I haven't written a review for Say Cheese yet. The guys that work there are super knowledgeable and fun to chat with.  I've lived in Upper Haight for 3 years and have gone to this quaint little store for a number of reasons, a few of which are:

- I desire amazing cheeses and meats at competitive/low prices
- I fancy a sandwich that truly does my $9 justice (the prosciutto mozzarella, my friends. It never fails me.) 
- I'm in dire need of a baguette and complimentary wine to go with the said meats/cheeses that I've recently purchased

I always walk into Say Cheese looking longingly at the rows and rows of salami and neatly packaged, local goat cheese. 

I always leave Say Cheese feeling accomplished, with a bounce in my step and a couple samples of truffle-infused cheese in my belly.
author: Hannah L.

description: Aside from the vast selection of gourmet goods, this fine delicatessen is THE watering hole for sandwich connoisseurs. Say Cheese uses the finest of the finest ingredients for a really rich, complex sandwich. Don't even bother asking for additional condiments on the sandwiches they offer on the board. You can't go wrong with their dressing/bread/meat matchups on their menu.  Cajun turkey with Creole mustard? Sure! London Broil and garlic cream cheese? I wouldn't have thought of that. They have hand cut chocolate covered nougat within fingers reach from the cash register. Prices are relatively reasonable considering you get dinner proportions for lunch lodged between gourmet bread slices.
author: John D.

description:
I'll say this -- the owner is gruff, but he sure knows his cheese.  Talking to him about cheese -- his face lights up, he becomes very animated, very informative, and very passionate.  This man clearly knows his cheese. Contrast that with trying to talk about anything else (I think I mentioned something about my dog yapping outside), and he couldn't care less.

So be ready to talk cheese and to listen to his advice, and he'll hook you up with some great cheese: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/SdGtfr9n1rgRXxNRMfqxzQ?select=Tu-QLP7WNXFaMTyJ8IN1Nw
author: Eugene F.

description:
I love Cheese shops! mmm cheese
This one was particularly good. With wonderfully helpful staff, and a wide selection. I think a previous yelper stated it properly, that you do get what you pay for and even though the cheese is expensive it is worth it. 

Although, I have to say that I delayed yelping about this place. I was chatting with the guy helping us and while I was buying my cheese i mentioned that I would give a good yelp review. He rolled his eyes and basically said that yelp was overrated and he didn't really care. Did someone really give them a bad review in the past? I didn't ask, I just paid for my cheese, thanked him and left.
author: Krystal W.

description:
Come payday, I like to treat myself to some high class cheese and or/sandwich.

Roger and the rest of the staff have opened my eyes to a variety of new cheeses, wines, and champagnes, for when I'm feeling fancy.

The fact that Whole Foods is opening up down the street just means I'll be coming here more!  Plus, I've noticed Roger seriously hooks up his customers.  Whole Foods doesn't.....which is fine.

I always get their veggie sandwich! It's giant, and makes up two of my meals for  a day, basically.  It's simple, but something about it is amazing.

The coffeeshop/cafe next door is also a must! I'm hooked.
author: Ashlie G.

description:
Sandwiches are super awesome, taste and price! 

They have a lot of unique cheese, chocolate, cured meats, wine, mustard and other condiments. Great for finding a cool fancy gift. A little pricy.
author: Scott J.

description: My favorite cheese shop in they city!!! Best selection, very friendly, and great sandwiches. Grab some cheese and have a picnic at the park!
author: C C.

description:
Normally, my BF does the shopping here because he's all into the cheese.  He'll return all jauntily from a visit here with all sorts of plastic-wrapped, smelly, flavorful, bundles of fat.  And normally, I don't partake because I'm acutely aware of how many calories are in 2 cubes the size of dice (I was an Atkins follower before I turned South Beach and ended in vegan-land).  

Today, was like no other day.  I'd just been horribly disappointed with the pate at Cafe C.  You know that feeling where you ate a substantial amount of something not very tasty but hoping that it'll get better with each bite, but it does not so now you are bloated, big, malnourished but still craving something?  This was me.  Normally I walk by this place and I think, FAT.  Today I walked by and the word Charcuterie caught my eye.  That instantly got translated in my brain as "Meat and PATE!"  You will never see a small Asian girl scuttle so quickly in here as I did that day.  You'd have though Brad Pitt was giving away hugs.  

Inside, the person behind the counter barely let me ask the question, "which pate do you prefer?" before he answered, "truffle mouse."  he said it in the same solemn, near-religious, assertive, knowing, matter-of-fact way that people answer factual questions.  "what time is it?"  "it's 1:30."  I probed a little more, because the foie de canard looked like a glistening block of love, a caramel-topped tub of i-want-to-rub-it-all-over-the-cracker, a plastic enrobed invitation to just use your hands.  

He gave me a little taste of it, and I was sold.  I bought about 1/2 inch thick slab.  He wrapped up my precious addiction and I paid for it.  it cost EONS less than the pate i'd just choked down at lunch ($4).  I was able to chose my method of transportation (Boulange's mini baguettes), and the manner (secretly, on the couch, before the BF gets home), and the frequency.  

That is control.  And control is what every small person wants.  Just look at Napoleon.
author: Christina C.

description:
Groupon review - busy busy shop. Looked like it was bigger on sandwiches than the cheese. I got some cheese and truffle oil. They had a variant of a Grana Padano variety I'd been looking for (they serve shavings at Pizza Delfino). 

It is very very good cheese and for the fact I cannot find it elsewhere I give 4 stars. As far as ambiance I felt like I was more in a deli than cheese spot like Spuntino's. All in all a good experience, perhaps should try a sandwich next time as that seemed to be the big draw when i was there.
author: Nelson C.

description: This place is wonderful. Great selection of charcuterie and delicious sandwiches made to order. Shop is also stocked nicely with accompaniments such as sauces, pickled things, crackers, wide olive oil and vinegar selection, jams, wine, and more! Highly recommended.
author: Alana S.

description:
Yum!  

Delicious sandwiches for sure.  I like the dutch crunch bread (I heard a guy tell his friend in the most serious voice "seriously man, get the dutch crunch, trust me on this," since then I have always got the dutch crunch - that guy was right!), fresh roasted turkey and cranberry (no actual cheese).  It's very, very delicious.  The guys that work there are also very nice.  

It's an unsuspecting sandwich place, but, boy is it good!  Stop on by.  One day I'll actually try the cheese
author: Brittney B.

description:
Awesome place for awesome deli sandwiches. Since I am a big fan of salami, I was truly overjoyed to see that they added the Rosette de Lyon, one of my most fave ones. When I'm in the mood for a different one, the Finocchiona is also a winner in my book.

The staff may not be the friendliest, but they're a staple of the shop. Without them and their keepin-it-real attitude, this place wouldn't be the same.

As Alice from 97.3FM would say (before they got booted off the air), "Freakin' try it!"
author: Vien N.

description: We normally love this place, the food is excellent.  However, on our last visit the two men working there, younger men, were making sandwiches with NO gloves on and handling money at the same time.  I don't think that's the most sanitary way to make a sandwich or any food for that matter.  Perhaps when the boss is away the mice will play.  The young man with glasses who helped us didn't seem to want to be there anyway, the store was empty and it took a while to even be asked what we wanted.  Why?  That is the smallest store, he didn't see us standing waiting for him?
author: B K.

description: Trying to keep this spot on the DL but I couldn't not write them up after the wonderful service I received yesterday.  They let me sample anything I wanted, were friendly and incredibly knowledgeable (without being stuck up). I even walked out with a free batch of honey and new customer discount! I could have stayed all day....
author: Ariane M.

description: Amazing cheese selection and the cheese mongers know their stuff, always super helpful with an excellent recommendation. Also, we tried their catering service last Christmas, beyond pleased!  Really can't go wrong here.
author: V R.

description:
This is an open love letter to Edward, who helped me with cheese: 

Dear Edward the Art  Graduate, 

Thank you for helping me prepare for my Oscar party. As we discussed, I am not a "foodie," or cheese expert. But you met my needs and found me an array of cheeses just under my budget. Thank you for your patience, understanding, and tolerating my shameless tasting. You are very knowledgeable but still communicated on my level. I will always appreciate the help you gave me today. You have inspired me to host parties more often!

Cheers,
Halley
author: Halley B.

description: This place has delicious and amazing cheese as well as a knowledgeable staff.   I am a hard-core cheese fan and this place had exactly the cheese I was looking for.  The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because they always run out of bread for their sandwiches around 5pm.  I love me some Dutch Crunch but they always seem to be out.
author: Ona B.

description: I love this place. The staff is EXTREMELY helpful and patient with me. They pick out great recommendations and let me taste them before I buy them. The cheese and meats are some of my favorites I've ever had. I'm a young guy, so I'm not exactly a huge expert, but I am learning a lot from my purchases here.
author: Corry F.

description:
I LOVELOVELOVE this shop!! It's almost as if Italy crash landed in your mouth and made you an offer you just couldn't refuse.

I almost don't want others to know about it so I won't have to wait in a long line for a sandwich. I work only a few blocks away and my coworkers and I are constantly stopping by to get their delicious signature sandwiches before our staff meetings. My personal favorite is the prosciutto, basil, and fresh mozzarella on ciabatta. Top that off with a can of San Pelligrino and you're set! You can walk over to the park around the corner and enjoy lunch in the sun.

It's a small shop, but they have a nice selection of cheeses, wines, chocolates (especially the truffle chocolates *drool*), olives, tapanades, dried nuts and fruits, breads, crackers and jams... you really need to stop by and take a peek around. They'll let you sample the cheeses and are knowledgeable about their selection... I suggest you let them choose a couple new cheeses to take home with a bottle of vino. It can get a bit expensive, but I go a little crazy every time I come here and get way too much. :) Oh hell... cheese is worth it!

The owner and employees have all been so very sweet and attentive to me. I always feel really welcomed when I come in. One day, I noticed that they were simmering some wonderful smelling tomato sauce in a crockpot and asked the owner what he was cooking. He ran over to Reverie (the coffee shop that he also owns) to bring a meatball for me to try, along with the sauce. What a sweetheart!! He also gave me a free cup of coffee to try to sway me from Tully's coffee shop across the street... he was trying to "keep it in the family" since I go to Say Cheese at least once a week. Hah hah.

Forget about McDonald's, the burritos that feel like lumps in your stomach, or the Americanized Asian fare and Denny's-like menus you find all over the Upper Haight. Come to Say Cheese and feast!
author: Suzi G.

description:
Saying cheese is supposed to be a close approximation to smiling in a photograph, but there was no "approximate" smile on my face after biting into one of their delicious sandwiches.  It was full blown smile.  Straight tasty stuff.  

I'm not a wine or cheese connoisseur, so I am not going to speak to that selection, which look varied, but since I lack the knowledge will now speak no more.
author: Bobby K.

description:
Their sandwiches are amazing!!! I pretty much always get the chicken & sundried tomato, although the few others I've tried are pretty much just as fantastic. I work around the corner, and on those crazy busy days when I just want to go home and be grouchy I take my lunch break and stop on by and a few bites later, my day is oh so much better. 
I read some of the other reviews, and yeah, the owners can be a little, shall we say, distant, but all their employees are friendly and honestly, it doesn't really bother me, I think it kind of adds charm to the store, in some peculiar way. But that's just me.
I have yet to buy any of their other foods for sale, but one of these days when I finally throw a fabulous wine and cheese party, Say Cheese will be my go to place.
author: Emily D.

description:
They have a fantastic selection of cheeses and meats.  Staff was to the point, but polite; didn't waste my time, but were curtious.

They made a mistake in my sandwich, but happy replaced it and were very appologetic. 
Also provided samples and they have a selection I do not see normally (Iberico ham...yum)
author: Anya W.

description:
Cheese!  Cheese!  Cheese!  And more cheese!  I'm in heaven!!!!

I truly believe I may have purchased the best brie I've ever had from this cheese shop (pesto pine nut).  The next time I get a major cheese hankering I will definitely be making a trip to Say Cheese.  Can't wait to try others in the seemingly endless selection!
author: Jacqueline T.

description: Great selection of cheeses, cured meat and wine in a small shop. Very helpful shopkeeper too.
author: Teresa L.

description:
These people know their cheese, but that's not all they have to offer.  They've got a great deli, nice wine collection and some wonderful chocolate choices. What more could a lady want?

Staff is super friendly, dont be afraid to tell them if you are clueless about cheese... let them recommend something amazing. You wont be disappointed.
author: Betsy F.

description:
So I took my new friend, who's fresh off the plane from France here, and she was mildly impressed.  WOAH!!!  That's right, she's a real French mademoiselle, and she vaguely approved of a store that sells cheeses here in the U.S.

That's gotta be worth at least 862 stars right there.

She guided me through an assortment of French & Spanish cheeses, and I left with a bagful of Emmental, Cantal, & Reblochon.  All were delicious (and yes I did share with co-workers . . . this time).

I should add, however, that you don't have to bring your own French expert.  On previous visits, the staff here have also been quite knowledgeable.  The pricing is very fair, and for such a tiny shop, their variety runs deep and wide. 

Oh, and just in case you aren't thoroughly convinced that you should pay this store a visit, I'll add the kicker: they also sell imported meats, wines, chocolate and coffee.

Stop by, maybe you'll run across me and mon amie francaise, looking mildly bored as we loiter on the stoop, stuffing our pouty mouths with giant hunks of cheese.  

Ooo la-la, tres chique!
author: Ravena F.

description: Best spot to assemble a picnic.  My favorite sandwich is the jambon, gruyere, and beurre on a pantofolino roll.  And that would be real French beurre.  They don't mess it up with lettuce or tomatoes either (unless you want them to).  The folks behind the counter are super nice!
author: Andrea J.

description:
Is it any coincidence that a photographer will tell you to "say cheese" when taking your picture? This is done because when you say the word cheese it instantly produces a smile. 

Are smiles addictive? Cheese smiles, that is? Is CHEESE addictive?? 

Do you have to admit you have a problem if you......

. Eat cheese to calm nerves or to forget worries
. Have guilt about eating cheese
. have unsuccessful attempts to cut down/stop
entering Say Cheese
. Lie about or hide that super yummy truffle cheese
. Cause harm to someone else if they try to take your $30 a lb to die for goat cheese
. Need to eat increasingly greater amounts of the product in this store
. Feel irritable when deprived of the cheese and wine and other gourmet goodies Say Cheese sells
. Have medical, social, family, financial,
or legal problems caused by cheese
. Are depressed when Say Cheese is closed
. Missed work because you were sampling for hours (they are very generous with the samples)

I say any word that instantly makes you smile is no problem at all. And if there is a neighborhood pusher who gives you free samples even after you are addicted then can it really be bad?

Denial? No way!!
author: Drue C.

description:
Italian gorgonzola picante?  Check.
A good goat cheeze for pizza?  Try this one . . . not strong enough . . . ok try this one, it's Spanish.  Good?  Check.
Fresh mozzarella? Check.
A good wine to go with gourmet pizza? Check.

5 stars for fantastic selection, knowledgeable owner, friendly service with a smile, and right on my walk home.
author: Joe C.

description:
Brrrriiiing Briinnnng
"Say Cheese"
Me: Hi, um, I was wondering if you had any Tete de Mooyynne in stock?
"Tete de Muwwha"
Me: Huh?
"It's pronounced Tete de Muwwha"
Me: Oh - so you have some
"Yeah. I got a half round"
Me: Oh. That sounds like a lot.  
"This is about an inch and a half. It's almost indestructable - it'll last you two, three months. It's like an indestructible gruyere. You got a girolle?
Me: Yeah. Last time I got the end round of about an inch, lasted me a couple months.
"MIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIKE!!!"
Me: Wha-what? Is that your name?
"No I wasn't talking to you. I'm throwing meat across the store at someone"
Me: Oh - well that's quite the visual.
"We're a very visual store"

Good enough for me.
author: CINDY K.

description:
I mainly go to Say Cheese for their excellent sandwiches. Seriously good sandwiches. They have a super tasty menu and the bread and meat is excellent. My roommate tells me the veggie is good too.

I don't really hit them up for cheese that often, but they have an excellent selection - beyond the usual suspects - and the staff actually know what they are talking about.
author: Matt S.

description:
If you don't know me, I go to cheese stores specifically to taste & buy all kinds of cheese, and here, it was no different. Because I've read numerous positive reviews for Say Cheese's sandwiches, the plan was to meet a friend here, buy some sandwiches & of course, lots of cheese and go picnic somewhere with my home-brought wine. First off, I want to say customer service here SUCKS! And I'm in the customer service industry so I usually have patience & can put up with a lot. I got greeted with a sarcastic, "What do you want?" Then, when I asked if they were sampling cheeses, I get a "Only if you buy some." In shock & not knowing what to think, I felt obligated, tasted a couple cheeses, bought some, & got out of there as soon as I could. When everything that happened finally hit me, I could not believe what just happened and I can honestly say that this is one of the first times I have ever felt like s-h-i-t coming out of someplace where I was the customer. 

On top of that, the sandwich that I got (pepper turkey with smoked gouda) was nothing special. Grocery stores sandwiches are better in my perspective. And I don't think the cheese was that fresh at all either. First & last time I'm ever going here!
author: Alysha K.

description:
The guys who work at the shop with a cheesy name are the salty types one might expect to find in a Brooklyn deli.  They know their cheeses, meats, and olives, but sometimes they feel the need to question how well I know mine.

Cheese Guy: "You sure you want a WHOLE pound of Kalamata AND a half pound of Nicoise?  What's it for?"
Me: "Yeah, I'm sure.  I'm making a tapanade mountain for my alpine tablescape. Where's the capers?" 
CG: "Oh, OK, sorry.  Just checking.  And you know that's whole milk mozzarella, right?"
Me: "Yeah, does it matter?"
CG: "No, I just wanted to make sure."

Was he calling me fat?  Oh well, I can tolerate being treated like an overweight culinary moron if that is what it takes to keep shopping here.  The service is great (despite my previous kvetching) and the sandwiches are perfect.  Everything about this store exudes high quality and taste, and the prices are reasonable compared to a lot of other boutiquey cheese shops in this city.

---

Update 6/5/07

I went in yesterday and we all had a good laugh when I said, "I'll take a tub of rendered duck fat," but then I had to reassure them that I really  meant it, and AGAIN they questioned my olive purchase.  What gives?
author: Quinn S.

description:
Great cheese selection and mediocre service.  

Stood there in front of the cheese counter waiting for someone to help me while the one woman behind the counter did basically nothing, puttering about and chatting with other customers who had already bought their items for almost five minutes before coming over to ask me if I needed anything.  

If I hadn't needed to buy one cheese I wouldn't have bought anything - but i was planning on getting a few more  but can't stand supporting businesses with lousy service.
author: David M.

description:
I stopped into this store because it reminded me of cheese shops in Brooklyn (not that they are totally different in every city hah!). Something about it just felt right.

And yeah.. well I was right :)

Friendly service. Great sandwiches. Fair prices. Good selection.

Win.
author: Fede O.

description:
